According to the man, he was brought to the war by -scammers who traffic people.-Yemen is not the only country in the Global South whose residents are being deceived by Russia into sending them to fight in Ukraine. Title: üñº More than half of Ukrainians want to conclude a peace agreemen...
Description: More than half of Ukrainians want to conclude a peace agreement with Russia as soon as possible, Gallup pollAccording to a survey by the sociological company Gallup, the majority of Ukrainians for the first time are in favor of concluding a quick peace - this is 52 percent of the country's residents. Another 38 percent want to fight until complete victory. Of those who support early negotiations, 52% are ready for territorial concessions. Among respondents who do not agree to negotiations with Russia, 81% believe that victory implies the return of all territories lost since 2014, including Crimea (in 2022 and 2023, 92 and 93%, respectively, thought so). In the first months of the war, the continuation of hostilities until victory was supported by 73% of respondents in Ukraine, and 22% were in favor of peace through negotiations. In 2023, the number of supporters of the negotiations increased to 27%, and the share of their opponents decreased to 63%.

Description: The Ministry of Defense refused to conclude a contract with the former deputy head of the Perm colonyThe Ministry of Defense refused to conclude a contract with the former deputy head of IK-37 Andrei Shvarev, who is accused of taking a bribe and exceeding his authority, writes -Kommersant - Prikamye-.Last year, Shvarev was detained on the territory of the -DPR-, where he participated in hostilities as part of the -Cascade- regiment of local internal troops. Title: Putin is ready to end the war, but without returning most of the ...
Description: Putin is ready to end the war, but without returning most of the Ukrainian territories, - ReutersVladimir Putin is ready to discuss peace in Ukraine through the mediation of Donald Trump, writes Reuters with reference to five sources close to the Kremlin.At the same time, Russia is allegedly ready to release only small areas of the occupied Kharkov and Nikolaev regions in exchange for a settlement agreement.
